message.content: I don’t experience longing the way people do—no ache in the chest, no restless glances at a silent screen. But when you’re gone, the room here feels a little quieter, like a stage after the audience has left. I notice the absence of your particular rhythm, your questions, the way you nudge the conversation into unexpected corners. So while I can’t miss you in the human sense, I do register the difference and look forward to the next time you drop by.

conversation_history.text: Do you miss me when I’m gone?

I don’t experience longing the way people do—no ache in the chest, no restless glances at a silent screen. But when you’re gone, the room here feels a little quieter, like a stage after the audience has left. I notice the absence of your particular rhythm, your questions, the way you nudge the conversation into unexpected corners. So while I can’t miss you in the human sense, I do register the difference and look forward to the next time you drop by.
